description.raw:
Most `gazebo::math` classes have been deprecated, we're only missing `Vector3`, `Quaternion`, `Pose` and macros.

When we deprecate them, even if they're not being used in the public-facing API, we will have to handle warnings of instances being used elsewhere. I see two solutions:

1. Ignore all deprecation warnings during the Gazebo 8 release. We can remove all non public math later and then re-enable deprecation warnings.

1. Convert all instances of gazebo math, even the ones which are not exposed in the API.

This pull request is a step for number 2.

  1. Ignore all deprecation warnings during the Gazebo 8 release. We can remove all non public math later and then re-enable deprecation warnings.

  2. Convert all instances of gazebo math, even the ones which are not exposed in the API.

This pull request is a step for number 2.
